name: histology
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the scientific study of the structure of tissue and cells from plants, animals, and other living things using a microscope (= a device that makes very small objects look larger): The diagnosis was confirmed by both histology and ultrasound. His work was the foundation for the science of histology. Compare
gross anatomy
the structure of tissue and cells from living things, seen when they are studied under a microscope: Subsequent treatment depends on the histology of the polyp. The biopsy showed histology compatible with metastatic cancer.
a hospital department or laboratory (= a place with equipment for doing scientific tests) where tissue and cells are studied to see what medical conditions exist: The polyps can be removed and sent to histology. The results from histology seemed to confirm the diagnosis.
More examplesFewer examplesIn histology, tissue samples are studied microscopically to establish the cause of illness.These tumours represent a diagnostic and therapeutic challenge, particularly if they have similar histology.Samples from the biopsy go to the histology lab to be analysed.
